file_content.text: As you're among the few people I can trust here, would you take on another matter?
A local man named Ilox has requested Republic assistance in the Red Light Sector. If you find yourself there, please speak to him.
You and I have much to discuss, Bareesh. Farewell, my friends.
Thank you for everything, my friend. You saved the Republic mission on Nar Shaddaa.
Word is spreading of the so-called Mountain's defeat.
With their leader dead, the majority of the Kintan Kings are scrambling to leave our territory. We've won!
I've never encountered an enemy quite like the Mountain before.
That was quite a battle.
Let's hope it's the last we see of their kind.
I wish there had been some other way to achieve peace.
The violence was regrettable.
As do I, but Republic lives were on the line. We had no choice.
Another victory for the Republic, courtesy of Havoc Squad.
We always do.
Now they've seen what our military forces can do!
Those gangsters will think twice before they mess with us again.
We taught them a lesson.
And you fought them off without benefit of military training or a lightsaber. Impressive.
Those gangsters are finished.
Many innocent people owe you their lives. You're a hero and an inspiration.
Correction--I won.
You're quite something, there's no denying it.
The Republic truly can't thank you enough. Please accept this token of our appreciation.
And allow me to supplement that reward with one of my own.
Oh, Bareesh--you're much too generous.
I appreciate the bonus.
Don't discourage him.
I agree completely, of course.
Just hand over the money.
Yes, of course. I was impolite.
I hate imposing on you further, my friends, but a local man named Ilox keeps requesting help from Republic representatives.
I realize you're busy, but a local man named Ilox keeps requesting Republic assistance.
I'd consider it a personal favor if you looked into this. Ilox is in the Red Light Sector.
Come, Ambassador. We have great things to accomplish together. Farewell, my friends!
Come, Ambassador. You and I have great things to accomplish. Farewell, my faithful friend!
The Kintan Kings are retreating, thanks to you. The Republic's citizens are finally safe.
I should be happier, but Bareesh just told me some distressing news.
I revealed my shameful past. Are you pleased with yourself?
Jedi are sworn to uphold the truth, Bareesh.
I had no choice.
An annoying policy. Now, matters are complicated.
A Jedi places duty above petty emotions.
I have no feelings on this.
And will your ambassador place the Republic's good above his obvious anger?
If I'd held back what I knew, it would've been treason.
I had a duty to the Republic.
Do not be so dramatic. The only loyalty being questioned is mine.
I'm sure you still have plenty of skeletons in your cargo locker.
I doubt you told everything.
You speak nonsense while an important alliance hangs by a thread.
Telling the truth is good.
But just as I feared, your ambassador is not pleased.
Yes, very.
I should kill you for humiliating me! Er... but I am reformed, so I will not.
Nar Shaddaa is critical to the Republic's future, and allies are in short supply.
I'll work with you, Bareesh--but I'll keep a close eye on your activities.
Wonderful! I will never disappoint you.
Thank you for everything you did--especially revealing the truth.
Of course.
I still have free time.
The truth is, there are other problems requiring attention.
I hope you'll forgive me for seizing upon your generosity, Master Jedi.
If you aren't required to be elsewhere, soldier, there is something else.
Actually, there's a situation elsewhere you might be perfect for.
I'm grateful for your enthusiasm. The fact is, I could use your help elsewhere.
We're finished, got it?
I hope my decision to trust Bareesh hasn't upset you. The truth is, I still need your help.
We have many details to sort out, Bareesh. Goodbye, my friend.
I'm sharing news of your victory with Coruscant. Bareesh will speak with you until I complete my report.
The Republic will never be safe until the Kintan Kings are destroyed.
Did you learn anything about the Kintan Kings or their mysterious leader at the slave market?
We have to free our people from that slave market--especially the children.
Thank the stars you recovered those combat implants.
Get those combat implants before it's too late. There's no time to lose!
I'm Ambassador Averdon. This is Bareesh Fenn'ak Torill, one of the system's most prominent business leaders. Welcome.
I am honored to meet such brave defenders of the Republic.
The Jedi are renowned throughout the galaxy. I am honored to meet you.
There are no finer warriors than the Republic's stalwart defenders. I salute you.
I regret my ignorance of your reputation. I look forward to being enlightened.
Make yourself comfortable. Any friend of the ambassador's is a friend of mine.
I was starting to wonder if the Republic was all alone here.
Good to see we have an ally.
Far from it. Bareesh has been a great friend to the Republic in a dark time.
Bring me up to speed.
I'm afraid we're at war with the underworld.
What a lovely couple. The wedding should be spectacular.
Aren't you two just adorable?
Please, this is no time for levity. Circumstances are dire.
My mission is to establish strong Republic ties on Nar Shaddaa. We need its technological assets to defend ourselves against the Empire.
Nar Shaddaa's leaders sold us an entire sector to use as our base of operations. Unfortunately, it's overrun with Kintan King gangsters.
Their days are numbered. That's a promise.
I'll get rid of them.
I should warn you--these are no ordinary criminals.
Nar Shaddaa isn't known for its law-abiding citizens. No offense, Hutt.
That's hardly surprising.
Negative propaganda, I assure you. Most of our citizens are decent people.
Why is that an issue?
The gang considers us invaders. They've turned our sector into a war zone.
The Kintan Kings want us out of their territory--and they're winning.
A Jedi who was helping us was found butchered in the open street. Those gangsters did horrible things to him.
You're sure it was gangsters who killed the Jedi?
Shocking--and suspicious.
Yes and no. Reliable information is scarce.
The Jedi Masters on Tython need to hear about this.
Inform the Jedi Council.
I'm not authorized to contact Tython, but we have done some investigating.
It takes more than a few cheap thugs to kill a Jedi.
That requires heavy artillery.
We believe the gang's leader is more than a mere criminal.
That guy was either a terrible Jedi, or those gangsters are something special.
That's an odd wrinkle.
The Jedi was young, but very strong. We believe this gang is indeed unique.
Give me the grisly details.
We're not certain, but there were strange cuts and markings on his body. Almost ritualistic.
Can this get any worse?
It's an inconceivable tragedy that such a strong young Jedi could die so easily.
We hear rumors that the gang's leader is a Morgukai.
Morgukai are a Nikto cult--Jedi hunters trained to resist the Force.
I've been trained to deal with Sith, Ambassador.
I'm not afraid.
I assume the dead Jedi was, too.
Resisting the Force is one thing. Overcoming it is quite another.
That doesn't make them immune.
Regardless, I thought I should warn you.
I have the training and armament to take him down.
It's all the same to me.
I suppose he'll have no advantage over you.
Personally, I think the Force is overrated.
Glad I'm not a Jedi.
In this case, you may be right.
Enough speculating.
You're not deterred by anything I've said, then? Thank goodness.
Regardless, he's dead.
I believe I can accommodate you.
The gangsters' attack on Minister Plennid was a diversion. Their true goal was hijacking a Republic military freighter carrying cybernetic combat implants.
The implants were my goodwill gesture to the Republic. They are finest-quality technology.
We don't need Kintan Kings with enhanced speed and strength.
When you have the implants, take them to an arms merchant named Nurkolas. He secretly works for Bareesh.
Nurkolas will provide a fortified base of operations for you. He has many things you will find useful.
Now go--bring those Kintan King scum to their knees! Er, for the good of the Republic....
Tell me where to find the gangsters. I'll handle the rest.
Can't argue with that.
Wouldn't mind testing myself against some of them.
They'd be fun to fight.
You would be impressed, assuming you survived.
I get it, already!
I should at least tell you where to find the gangsters.
The hijackers flew the freighter to a "chop shop" to turn the ship into spare parts. They're unloading it as we speak.
If you have any useful information, now is the time.
Any last advice?
We have no idea what sort of opposition you'll face--just hurry.
I'm already out the door.
Good. Every second counts.
That's all? No problem!
Whatever you plan to do, do it quickly.
This is a disaster, Bareesh. How can I deal with enemies who don't negotiate?
The Kintan Kings only understand one language, Ambassador.
Minister Plennid sent me. I have your stolen security passcodes.
I'm here to help.
I couldn't believe our luck when he sent word you were coming. You have my gratitude.
They understood getting smacked down, I can tell you that.
The language of violence?
Violence never requires translation, but it often causes deafness.
Isn't Huttese the mother tongue of criminals across the galaxy?
Hutts don't speak "gangster"?
That is a horrible stereotype. We are not all fiendish gangsters, I assure you.
Minister Plennid sent word you were bringing our security passcodes. The Republic is in your debt.
Please excuse me. I'm in a holoconference with Coruscant.
I'm Ambassador Averdon with the Republic's Diplomatic Corps. Welcome to Nar Shaddaa.
